reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a clean, quiet place to stay in a sometimes crazy city then this will be fine. The guy at the front desk was helpful with directions and while the guy who served breakfast wasn't the friendliest, he made great cappucinos. It's clean and safe and actually quiet even though it's one block of the main street; good location for walking to all the sites you would want to see and it felt perfectly safe. It's a bit no-frills, but who stays in their room much when they're in Italy?
reviews.title: Totally decent and safe place to sstay when in Naples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 6 nights at San Pietro and enjoyed it. Hotel used to be quite grand 20 yrs ago, now its a bit worn out but the rooms are good size, all the required services are there, the lobby is lovely, the staff is friendly. The loction is excellent, close to train station and walking distance to old town. Very close to some of the best pizzerias in town too.
reviews.title: Value for money and great location
Anti Gay Hotel! Stay far away! Rude and horrible service!!
reviews.text: Breakfast was included but its nothing to write home about - we were bringing our own after 3 days. However, at 60eur per night, the value for money is excellent and in a city that is dirty noisy and not always safe-feeling, San Pietro is a bit of an oasis.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel San Pietro appeared nice upon entering. At first the staff seemed friendly. However don't stay at this hotel! Bad location where noise of the city and street thugs are everywhere around outside. Felt very threatened. Returning back to hotel after going out with a local friend in Naples, we came back after midnight to have some wine in our room. The front lobby doors were locked. The midnight manager 'on duty' was sleeping and we were pounding on the door for 5 minutes until we woke him. Talk about being locked out of your own hotel! Upon opening the door with a dirty look for having woke him up while "on duty" he emphatically said that our friend could not visit with us in the room because things appeared "immoral" for the city code, ,etc with there being only 2 beds. This neanderthal, barbaric mentaliy in Naples is so hypocritical to the way of life in which the local people live it's disgusting! In addition, the air conditioning did not work, The room was extremely hot and humid during our stay and breakfast was tropical hawaiian punch for juice with store bought crackers and cheap pastries. I would say this is a place if you're traveling alone and only want to pay 40 Euros a night. However, it's more than that and certainly not worth it! Stay elsewhere, closer to the port near the cruise ships. Do not stay at San Pietro. After explaining the situation to the other manager on duty with hopes that they would even be concerned that their night shift employee sleeps on the job, they justified it by saying "You didn't have to wait more than a few minutes out side I'm sure" Such arrogance. What a joke!!!!
reviews.title: SUPER!!!

reviews.text: Very good located, very clean, very quiet, very friendly hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a rough area.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say that my stay at hotel san pietro was great. The front desk service was amazing. My husband and i travelled italy this summer on our honeymoon and we had no idea what to expect out of naples. But i can say that we felt at ease once meeting the staff at the hotel and having them help us out on where to eat and where to shop. They gave us helpful tips and made our trip even better. The hotel was very very clean and the maid service was exceptional. Breakfast isnt very grand but considering what Italy offers as a breakfast we were satisfied. The only downer on this hotel would have to be it's location. it is behind the main strip in naples and is about a ten minute walk from the train station but i guess its good if you dont like noise.
reviews.title: Exceptional service and helpfulness from the staff

reviews.text: We arrived there only to be told that the booking had changed, so we had not been contacted by any means to notify us that there was a change in plans. Instead of providing us with transport to the new hotel that we had been redirected to, the guy at reception claimed we would have to come back to speak to the supervisor. Possibly the worst service in Europe. The hotel that we were directed to had no hot water, which we had to repeatedly ask for an hour until there was a breakthrough, other than this it appeared to be the same class of hotel as the San Pietro. However, this is the last thing a weary traveller needs and therefore, you just can't trust them!
reviews.title: Turned away

reviews.text: We found the San Pietro to be centrally located, as expected, and quite comfortable and friendly. The staff was helpful in handling luggage, suggesting reasonably priced restaurants with good quality, provided friendly breakfast service. The rooms were comfortably furnished and amenities were adequate. A/C was minimal but adequate. However the staff''s difficulty with English did pose a few problems.
reviews.title: A nice friendly hotel with some drawbacks.
MIkhail from Russia
reviews.text: The night clerk spoke no english, and it was reported to me that at least 2 people called for me by phone and were told simply that no English was spoken. I received one message that I had had a call the day before just after i left the hotel. Had a note been left, I could have returned the call before lising 24 hrs.

The other drawback is that the interior street on which the hotel is located teems with street vendors, which is common in Naples. However, much of the merchandise being sold in the immediate vicinity is hard core videos - hardly desirable with children in the party.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were staying in the hotel 2 nights in May 2008. We've found hotel by chance and were really surpised quality of service, rooms and fiendly personnel of this hotel. For example: my wife forgot her earrings in the room, we found it in the evening in Rome only. We've called hotel and they found it and sent them to Russia with no problem and i would like to say thank them for that.
reviews.title: reasonable value but....

reviews.text: I stayed at Hotel San Pietro with my friend and we had a fabulous long weekend. The Staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel is located very close to the transport hub in Garibaldi square which made trips to Mount Vesuvius and Pompei very accessable and cheap too ( 5 Euro's return ticket). We did find great difficulty in finding somewhere to drink in the enevings however but after chatting to hotel staff they pointed us in the direction of a well priced bar (if not the only bar in the area!). One of the staff members Joseph even gave us tickets to visit pompei ruins for free and was at our beck and call for any assistance we required. The rooms were spacious, clean and well decorated. Not 5* for England but certainly 4-5* for the area. It is also very close to places to eat, whatever the time of the day or night. I would definately recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel San Pietro was our retreat from the chaos that is Naples. After spending hours on our feet, dodging cars and motorcycles in the streets (and sometimes on the sidewalk), getting mowed down by several Neopolitan grandmas daily, we would crash into our spacious clean room with relief.
